articles.author: Andrew Gray, Lili Bayer, Tom Balmforth
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy called on Saturday for the creation of a European army, arguing the continent could no longer be sure of protection from the United States and would only get respect from Washington with a strong military.
articles.title: Zelenskiy calls for European army to deter Russia, earn US respect

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz delivered a strong rebuke on Saturday to U.S. Vice President JD Vance's attack on Europe's stance toward hate speech and the far right, saying it was not right for others to tell Germany, and Europe, what to do.
articles.title: Germany's Scholz rebukes Vance, defends Europe's stance on hate speech and far right

articles.author: Phil Stewart, Idrees Ali
articles.description: U.S. Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth's attention-grabbing overseas debut may have irritated some key Republicans and alienated allies in Europe, where his statements on Ukraine and NATO went down like a lead balloon.
articles.title: US Defense Secretary Hegseth's Europe debut irks allies, wins Trump's nod

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov and U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio held a phone call on Saturday and agreed on regular contacts to prepare for a meeting between Russian President Vladimir Putin and U.S. President Donald Trump, Russia's Foreign Ministry said.
articles.title: Lavrov, Rubio agree on contacts to prepare for Putin-Trump meeting, Russia says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The capture of Bukavu would represent an unprecedented expansion of territory under the M23's control since the latest insurgency started in 2022.
articles.title: Congo PM demands 'withdrawal of Rwandan troops' after M23 reach Bukavu suburbs

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Maayan Lubell
articles.description: Israeli hostages Iair Horn, Sagui Dekel-Chen and Sasha (Alexander) Troufanov arrived at a release site in Gaza on Saturday after Egyptian and Qatari mediators helped avert a standoff that threatened to sink a fragile ceasefire.
articles.title: Three Israeli hostages set to return from Gaza as ceasefire holds

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio arrived in Tel Aviv late on Saturday in his first visit to the Middle East.
articles.title: Rubio arrives in Tel Aviv for first visit to Middle East as secretary of state

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Pope Francis, who is suffering from a respiratory infection, has spent a quiet night in hospital, the Italian news agency ANSA reported on Saturday.
articles.title: Pope spent a quiet night in hospital, ANSA says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine's Foreign Minister Andrii Sybiha and President Volodymyr Zelenskiy's chief of staff, Andriy Yermak, said late on Saturday that they had discussed Kyiv's vision of a path to peace in Ukraine with China's Foreign Minister Wang Yi.
articles.title: Ukraine's senior officials discuss Kyiv's peace vision with China's foreign minister

articles.author: Jessica DiNapoli, Julia Harte
articles.description: Some of the 75,000 U.S. federal workers who the Office of Personnel Management says accepted a resignation buyout offer were ready to retire anyway. Others were motivated by looming federal workforce cuts or an order to return to the office.
articles.title: Trump offered them a buyout. Here's why they took it
